entry.title: Combined summary - Seeking advice: Encouraging bug-fixing over new features
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the idea of offering bounties for fixing bugs in Bitcoin software. Gavin Andresen expresses doubts about the effectiveness of this approach, suggesting that it might only encourage "hacked together patches" instead of long-term contributions. However, Rick Wesson argues that improving the software would increase its value and offers an alternative suggestion of paying a salary to a technical lead who can oversee development efforts. The conversation also touches upon the implementation of a testing framework and the possibility of branching for bug fixes. Additionally, Gavin mentions that he has arranged to work on Bitcoin full-time and will provide more details upon his return from Australia.
